Author: djctavia
Content: It's probably a stupid question, but how players are sync on server ? Does some variables are only server side and the client request it, or do they use `RegisterNetSyncVariable`, I feel busted for not being sure of what variable are used on which side (Stupid question, when we know Health can only be retrieve through server, but if someone can go further in explication more than just telling me: "Server have all informations, except UI elements")

Author: aussiecleetus
Content: registernetsyncvariables are synched between client and server when SetSynchDirty() is called

Author: aussiecleetus
Content: though it is always the server's value that is sent to the clients

Author: aussiecleetus
Content: not the other way around

Author: aussiecleetus
Content: working out exactly what is running on server and what is running on client is actually a really intense undertaking sometimes

Author: arkensor
Content: Rule of thumb, anything that would have global effect is managed by the server.

Author: aussiecleetus
Content: ^ absolute truth

Author: QuickZ#5873
Content: logical and nice üòõ

Author: arkensor
Content: RegisterNetSyncVariable is mainly used for things that are always intended to be known by all clients in the bubble. Something like the variable state for constructing a base building item etc.

Author: arkensor
Content: If your client want's to know something that not everybody would care about, then it's better to send and rpc to the server requesting data and sending back the data to the rpc sender identity with the requested data

Author: djctavia
Content: Oh ok, thx, some things are starting to clear up better ^^
